result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Norman J. Price in court with attorney Lance M. Nelsen.  Defendant Norman J. Price in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Lance Nelsen issue of competency  DEF stands mute, State  waives necessity of any other evidence as does the DEF, Court based on the Report finds DEF is competent to stand trial.
Scanned & distributed (12/22/14 - Original report placed in file 13CM84 to replace faxed copy.)
Due to delay in opening at Mendota for DE, Competency exam/report delayed.  Rescheduled Competency hearing to 01/26/2015.  mak
Competency hearing on January 26, 2015 at 03:15 pm.
COPY OF DR. MINTER'S REPORT, COPY OF CRIMINAL COMPLAINT, AND A COPY OF THE ORIGINAL ORDER FOR COMPETENCY EXAMINATION FAXED TO MENDOTA THIS DATE FOR INPATIENT EXAM.

Defendant Norman J. Price in court with attorney Lance M. Nelsen.  Defendant Norman J. Price in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DEF did not cooperate with evaluation  wants DEF to be sent to inpatioent for evaluation.  State stipulates and concurs, DEF (recess)  DEF agrees to go to inpatient for evaluation,   Court so orders report must be filed within 15 days, doctor can appear by phone  Competency hearing scheduled for December 12, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
(scanned into all 5 cases, copies distributed, original in 13CF196)

Defendant's  Motion for Competency Examination; Order by court in all 5 matters for competency examination;  Doctor will be allowed to appear by phone.  Outpatient unless determined inpatient is necessary.  Bond remains.  Competency hearing scheduled for November 25, 2014 at 01:00 pm.  Bond remains.
